Type.Name: XML
Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the Gtk# Thread Programming for details.

Docs.summary: Allows dynamic loading of user interfaces from XML descriptions

remarks.para: This object represents an `instantiation' of an XML interface description. When one of these objects is created, the XML file is read, and the interface is created.

The object can also be used to connect handlers to the named signals in the description. The easiest way to use this feature is to let it automatically connect signal handlers for you. This can be achieved by using the method.

searches the specified or for method names matching those defined in the XML interface description file and connects them to the appropriate signals. It also searches for fields having the attached and tries to bind them to widgets of the same name defined in the XML description.

The following examples supposes that an XML interface description of a simple application exists in the file "gui.glade". The application consists of a main window ("MyWindow") which contains a button and a text entry ("MyEntry"). The handler for the button clicked signal is named "OnMyButtonClicked" and the handler for the window delete event is named "OnMyWindowDeleteEvent".

Docs.summary: Get the parent widget
Docs.returns: the object that built , or if is not built from Glade

Docs.summary: Gets the name of a Glade-built widget
Allows you to override the default behaviour when a Custom widget is found in an interface.

remarks.para: Setting this property allows you to override the default behaviour when a Custom widget is found in an interface. This could be used by a language binding to call some other function, or to limit what functions can be called to create custom widgets

Docs.summary: Deprecated: Replaced by the property.

Binds the widgets declared in the Glade interface specification, to argument's suitable fields. These fields should be marked with the attributes. Any signal declared in the interface specification should be connected using (for detailed control of signal connection) or , the mirror image of this method.
Docs.param: The object whose fields are to be bound to the object

Docs.summary: Automatically connect signals

remarks.para: Connects the signals defined in the glade file with static handler methods provided by the given , .

remarks.para: Connects the signals definied in the glade file with static handler methods provided by the given object, .

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetCommonParams (Gtk.Widget widget, Glade.WidgetInfo info);

Docs.summary: Sets the common parameters on a widget, and is responsible for inserting it into the object's internal structures.
Docs.param: the widget to set parameters on

remarks.para: Sets the common parameters on , and is responsible for inserting it into the object's internal structures. It will also add the children to this widget. Usually this function is only called by , but is exposed for difficult cases, such as setting up buttons and the like.

MemberSignature.Value: public void HandleInternalChild (Gtk.Widget parent, Glade.ChildInfo child_info);

Docs.summary: This function is intended to be called by the build_children callback for container widgets.

remarks.para: This function is intended to be called by the build_children callback for container widgets. If the build_children callback encounters a child with the internal-child attribute set, then it should call this function to handle it and then continue on to the next child.

Docs.summary: Automatically connect signals

remarks.para: This method uses gmodule's introspective features to look at the application's symbol table. From here it tries to match the signal handler names given in the interface description with symbols in the application and connects the signals.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool Construct (string fname, string root, string domain);

Docs.summary: This routine can be used by bindings (such as gtk--) to help construct a object, if it is needed.
This function is used to get the current . If there isn't one, a new one is created and bound to the current toplevel window (if a toplevel has been set).

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetPackingProperty (Gtk.Widget parent, Gtk.Widget child, string name, string value);

Docs.summary: This sets the packing property on container of widget with to
This function is not intended for people who just use libglade.

remarks.para: This function is not intended for people who just use libglade. Instead it is for people extending it (it is designed to be called in the child build routine defined for the parent widget). It first checks the type of the widget from the class tag, then calls the corresponding widget creation routine. This routine sets up all the settings specific to that type of widget. Then general widget settings are performed on the widget. Then it sets up accelerators for the widget, and extracts any signal information for the widget. Then it checks to see if there are any child widget nodes for this widget, and if so calls the widget's build routine, which will create the children with this function and add them to the widget in the appropriate way. Finally it returns the widget.

Docs.summary: This function resolves a relative pathname, using the directory of the XML file as a base.

remarks.para: This function resolves a relative pathname, using the directory of the XML file as a base. If the pathname is absolute, then the original filename is returned.

Docs.summary: This function is similar to except that it will try to connect all signals in the interface, not just a single named handler. It can be thought of the interpeted language binding version of , except that it does not require gmodule to function correctly.
Docs.param: the function used to connect the signals.

MemberSignature.Value: public void HandleWidgetProp (Gtk.Widget widget, string prop_name, string value_name);

Docs.summary: Used to set properties on s
Docs.param: the property the widget to set the property on.
the name of the widget used as the value for the property.

remarks.para: Some widgets have properties of type . These are represented as the widget name in the glade file. When constructing the interface, the widget specified as the value for a property may not exist yet.

Rather than setting the property directly, this function should be used. It will perform the name to conversion, and if the widget is yet to be constructed, defer setting the property until the widget is constructed.

Docs.summary: Retrieves a widget stored in the by name
Docs.param: the name of the widget to retrieve
Docs.returns: the widget specified by or if no Widgets of that name exists

MemberSignature.Value: public void SignalConnectFull (string handler_name, Glade.XMLConnectFunc func);

Docs.summary: This function is similar to , except that it allows you to give an arbitrary function that will be used for actually connecting the signals. This is mainly useful for writers of interpreted language bindings, or applications where you need more control over the signal connection process.
Docs.param: the name of the signal handler that we want to connect.
the function to use to connect the signals.
